title: Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU) - Kawartha Lakes
description: Structured checklist for homeowners planning an ADU in the City of Kawartha Lakes. Each item includes required docs, typical timelines, and the canonical source.

checklist_items.title: Zoning Review / Zoning Clearance
checklist_items.description: Confirm the property's zoning permits an ADU; check lot coverage, setbacks, height limits, and accessory building rules.
checklist_items.docs_required: Property deed/assessment, site plan showing setbacks, existing and proposed drawings
checklist_items.condition: Required to determine if a minor variance or zoning amendment is necessary
checklist_items.notes: If zoning does not allow an ADU, a variance or rezoning may be required; consult the municipal planning department.

checklist_items.title: Building Permit
checklist_items.description: Building permit application for the ADU to ensure OBC compliance (structural, fire separation, egress, insulation).
checklist_items.docs_required: Completed permit application, site plan, floor plans, elevations, construction drawings
checklist_items.condition: Required for new separate dwelling units, significant alterations, or changes in occupancy
checklist_items.notes: Follow OBC requirements for means of egress, fire separations and insulation; work with a designer or architect as needed.

checklist_items.title: Septic / On-site Services Review
checklist_items.description: Determine if the existing septic system supports an additional dwelling unit; if not, upgrades or permits may be required.
checklist_items.docs_required: Septic system records, inspections, soil tests (if requested)
checklist_items.condition: Required if the ADU adds new plumbing fixtures or increases occupancy; rural properties commonly need this check
checklist_items.notes: Kawartha Lakes may require septic approvals or inspections before building permits are issued.

checklist_items.title: Conservation Authority / Shoreline Review (if applicable)
checklist_items.description: If the property is near a watercourse or shoreline, a conservation authority permit or clearance may be required.
checklist_items.docs_required: Site plan showing proximity to water, photos, conservation authority application
checklist_items.condition: Applies when site is within regulated area; check local conservation authority jurisdiction
checklist_items.notes: Conservation authority jurisdiction may add separate permit steps or restrictions.

checklist_items.title: Electrical Permit / ESA Notification
checklist_items.description: Ensure electrical work is permitted and performed by a licensed electrician; major service changes normally require an ESA permit or notification.
checklist_items.docs_required: Electrical scope, electrician contact, single-line wiring diagram if service changes
checklist_items.condition: Required for new circuits, panels, or increased service capacity
checklist_items.notes: Refer to Electrical Safety Authority guidance for permit triggers.

checklist_items.title: Plumbing Permit
checklist_items.description: Plumbing permit for new fixtures or drainage changes associated with the ADU.
checklist_items.condition: Required if adding new plumbing fixtures or altering drainage
checklist_items.notes: If the ADU adds a bathroom/kitchen, plumbing permitting is likely required.

checklist_items.title: Heritage / Conservation Review (if applicable)
checklist_items.description: Check if the property is in a designated heritage area or subject to heritage controls.
checklist_items.condition: Applies if the property is listed or in a heritage conservation district
checklist_items.notes: Heritage restrictions can affect exterior alterations and additional approvals may be required.

checklist_items.title: Fees, Development Charges & HST
checklist_items.description: Understand applicable municipal fees, development charges and provincial HST treatment for construction and services.
checklist_items.condition: Review before contracting work; incorporate HST (Ontario 13%) into cost estimates
checklist_items.notes: Development charges may apply for large projects; consult municipal finance department.

checklist_items.title: Pre-application / Neighbour Consultation (recommended)
checklist_items.description: Consult neighbours and, if applicable, undertake a pre-application meeting with planning staff to surface issues early.
checklist_items.condition: Recommended for complex projects or where variances are likely
checklist_items.notes: Pre-application meetings reduce risk of surprises during formal review.
